results.deck: Tactical, Espionage, Action. A revered and long-running series directed by Hideo Kojima.
results.description:
Overview

The Metal Gear franchise follows the story of protagonist Solid Snake as he tries to rid the world of Metal Gears and atone for his sins. The Metal Gear series is well-known for its elaborate, complex plot-lines and large amount of cutscenes. The majority of games in the franchise fall under the Metal Gear Solid series.

Series Chronology

Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater (1964)

Main article: Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater

Setting: Russia - Groznyi Grad

Protagonist: Naked Snake

Allies: Eva, Sokolov

Radio team: Major Zero, Sigint, Para-medic

Enemies: The Boss, Volgin, Ocelot , The Cobras - The Pain, The Sorrow, The Fear, The Fury, The Philosophers

Metal Gear Solid: Portable Ops (1970)

Main article: Metal Gear Solid: Portable Ops

Setting: South America - San Hieronymo Peninsula

Protagonist: Naked Snake/Big Boss

Allies: Campbell, Jonathan, Elisa

Radio team: Sigint, Paramedic, Ghost

Enemies: FOX unit- Gene, Null, Cunningham, Python, Ursula

Metal Gear Solid: Peace Walker (1974)

Main article: Metal Gear Solid: Peace Walker

Setting: Costa Rica

Protagonist: Big Boss

Allies: Kazuhira Miller (Master Miller), Huey

Radio team: Amanda, Chico, Paz, Cecile Cosima Caminades

Enemies: Galvez, Coldman, The Patriots, Dr. Strangelove

Metal Gear Solid: Ground Zeroes (19??)

Main article: Metal Gear Solid: Ground Zeroes

Setting: TBC

Protagonist: Naked Snake

Allies: TBC

Radio team: TBC

Enemies: TBC

Metal Gear (1995)

Main article: Metal Gear

Setting: Outer Heaven

Protagonist: Solid Snake

Allies: Gray Fox

Radio team: Jennifer, Kyle Schneider

Enemies: Big Boss, Bloody Brad, Dirty Duck, Fire Trooper, Machine Gun Kid, Shotmaker

Metal Gear 2: Solid Snake (1999)

Main article: Metal Gear 2: Solid Snake

Setting: Zanzibar Land

Protagonist: Solid Snake

Allies: Holly White

Radio team: Campbell, Master Miller, George Kassler, Gustava Heffner, Johan Jacobsen

Enemies: Big Boss, Gray Fox, Black Ninja, Running Man, Four Horsemen, Jungle Evil, Night Fright, Red Blaster

Metal Gear Solid (2005)

Main article: Metal Gear Solid

Setting: Shadow Moses

Protagonist: Solid Snake

Allies: Meryl Silverburgh, Gray Fox

Codec team: Campbell, Naomi Hunter, Mei Ling, Nastasha Romanenko, Master Miller

Enemies: Liquid Snake, Revolver Ocelot, Psycho Mantis, Sniper Wolf, Vulcan Raven, Decoy Octopus

Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty (2007-2009)

Main article: Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty

Setting: Big Shell

Protagonist: Solid Snake, Raiden

Allies: Richard Ames, Mr. X, Peter Stillman, Emma "E.E." Emmerich

Codec team: Campbell, Rose, Otacon

Enemies: Solidus Snake, Ocelot, Olga Gurlukovich, Dead Cell - Vamp, Fortune, Fatman

Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns of the Patriots (2014)

Main Article: Metal Gear Solid 4: Gun of the Patriots

Setting: Unnamed Middleeastern Country, Unnamed South American Country, Unnamed European Country, Shadow Moses, Outer Haven

Protagonist: (Old) Solid Snake

Allies: Raiden, Metal Gear MK. II, Meryl and Rat Patrol 01- Johnny Sasaki, Ed, Jonathon, Mei Ling, Naomi Hunter, Big Momma/Eva, Drebin

Codec team: Otacon, Campbell, Rose

Enemies: (Liquid) Ocelot, Vamp, Beauty and the Beast unit - Laughing Octopus, Raging Raven, Crying Wolf, Screaming Mantis , The Patriots

Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance (2018 or 2019)

Main article: Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance

Setting: TBC

Protagonist: Raiden

Allies: TBC

Codec team: TBC

Enemies: TBC

Running Themes

Prisoner

In titles Metal Gear and Metal Gear Solid 1, 2, and 3. The main protagonist has been taken captive and must escape the prison on his own. Escaping consisted of punching a wall, faking your death, or just waiting to be saved.

Johnny

Every Metal Gear Solid game in the series has a soldier with bowel problems named Johnny. The first son of every generation of the Johnny family is named Johnny. The Johnny of MGS3 is the grandfather of the MGS 1, 2, and 4 Johnny.

Cyborg Ninja

The cyborg ninja is a robotically enhanced super soldier that aids Snake in his missions. In MGS1 it was Gray Fox, MGS2 Olga Gurlukovich, and MGS4 Raiden.

Hind D

The Mi-24D is the helicopter of choice in the Metal Gear Series. It is featured in Metal Gear 1 and 2 and Metal Gear Solid as a boss and a transport vehicle in MGS3.

Cigarettes

  • Main article: Cigarettes

Even though he is stripped down to nothing, Snake is always able to sneak a pack of cigs, probably by eating them. Big Boss on the other hand likes cigars instead.

Control

A major theme that Kojima gets across is that of control. Both Snake and Raiden follow orders without question, never thinking about why or for what purpose. Not only this, but The Patriots is an organization completely based on controlling all of mankind, and throughout the series Kojima clearly states how dangerous he thinks this can be.

Nanomachines

In the future, apparently, everyone will have nanomachines coursing through their veins. They allow people to have superhuman abilities, such as the ones exhibited by Vamp. They can also be used to keep people's emotions repressed, such as seen with the various PMCs seen throughout Metal Gear Solid 4. Nanomachines are another form of control.

War Economy

Metal Gear Solid 4 constantly emphasizes how in the MGS universe, the world has become a place governed by war, a slave to war. It is an age where countries can fight each other via proxy wars, not having to risk any of their own people or soldiers.
